snippet: The first round of peace negotiations ended without agreement over the easing of the Syrian government’s blockade of humanitarian aid to besieged communities.
abstract: First round of Syria peace talks ends without achieving even its most modest goal of easing the Syrian government's blockade on the delivery of food and medicine to besieged communities.

byline.original: By NICK CUMMING-BRUCE and MICHAEL R. GORDON
byline.contributor: Nick Cumming-Bruce reported from Geneva, and Michael R. Gordon from Washington. Somini Sengupta contributed reporting from the United Nations.

lead_paragraph: The first round of peace negotiations ended without agreement over the easing of the Syrian government’s blockade of humanitarian aid to besieged communities.

headline.main: Syrian Talks, Ending First Round, Fail Even to Agree on Easing Aid Blockade
headline.print_headline: Syrian Talks, Ending First Round, Fail Even to Agree on Easing Aid Blockade

keywords.value: Middle East and North Africa Unrest (2010- )
keywords.name: subject
